label: logicC:energy_en
steps: [1] If solar irradiance exceeds the PV array’s start-up threshold, the PV array generates DC power.
[2] If the PV array generates DC power, the inverter has sufficient DC input.
[3] If the inverter has sufficient DC input and the grid is synchronized, the system exports AC power to the grid.
[5] Solar irradiance exceeds the PV array’s start-up threshold.
[6] For every inverter x, if x complies with IEEE 1547, then x is approved for grid interconnection.
[8] For every inverter x, if x is approved for grid interconnection, then x either is under utility monitoring or has built-in anti-islanding protection.
[9] The PV array generates DC power. (from [1] and [5])
[10] The inverter has sufficient DC input. (from [2] and [9])
[11] The system exports AC power to the grid. (from [3] and [10] and [4])
[12] Inverter a is approved for grid interconnection, and inverter a either is under utility monitoring or has built-in anti-islanding protection. (from [6], [7], [8])
